nodes.body:
The locative is used to mark complements of place (with or without movement) or time (date, time), and is generally translated by English “at,” “to,” “in” or “on.”

  • ལ་དྭགས་ལ་ “To / in Ladakh”
  • ཨ་མེ་རི་ཀར་ “To / in America”
  • རྒྱ་གར་ལ་ “To / in India”
  • ཆུ་ཚོད་གཉིས་པར་ “At two o’clock”
  • ཚེས་པ་བཅོ་ལྔར་ “On the fifth (of the month)”
  • དགུན་གར་ “In winter”
nodes.title: About Locative Function of the Oblique Particle

meta.title: About Locative Function of the Oblique Particle
